subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The Naval Academy canceled classes yesterday to give the 4,400 midshipmen another day to celebrate the football team’s first victory over Notre Dame in 44 tries. Navy beat Notre Dame, 46-44, in triple overtime Saturday when Reggie Campbell caught a 25-yard touchdown pass and a 2-point conversion throw from Kaipo-Noa Kaheaku-Enhada. On the next drive, the Fighting Irish scored on Travis Thomas’s 5-yard touchdown run, but two Navy players tackled him on the 2-point conversion attempt.“We are all part of history because of this victory,” Vice Admiral Jeffrey Fowler, the academy’s superintendent, said in an e-mail to The Capital of Annapolis, Md.Notre Dame’s winning streak began in 1964, the year after Roger Staubach led the Midshipmen to a 35-14 victory.
